Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8214221553/job/22466460644)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8214221553/job/22466460496)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8214221553/job/22466460611)

Is it possible to relax the `CstarRing A` assumption for this and some of the other results below (i.e. `mem_unitary_of_spectrum_subset_circle`? It would be nice to be able to use those results for e.g. matrices.

ah yes, indeed it is possible. When I wrote this originally I had considered it, but then thought I couldn't get around using some `CstarRing` properties somewhere. However, you can, the key is `eqOn_of_cfc_eq_cfc`. Note that this is one of reasons we need the full power of the functional calculus (here we're using injectivity).

I have implemented these changes so that it will apply to matrices.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: instantiate the continuous functional calculus
